attributes.action: Save Craigie woodland in Ayr, South Ayrshire
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Five hundred trees could be torn down to make way for a huge university car park.
Developers want to fell the woodland at the historic Craigie Estate – one of the few remaining beauty spots in Ayr town centre.
The plan will reduce the number of trees in the popular estate by a massive 65 per cent.
For most of the residents of craigie and the whole of North Ayr this is the one and only urban wood and parkland available for recreation and asphetic enjoyment. As well as being a wildlife hotspot for Bats, Squirrels a massive variety of birds, insects and Small Mammals. Please help us preserve this beautiful area for generations to come.
